diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute tip appendicitis complicated by micro perforation with phlegmon and early abscess abutting the appendiceal tip.
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with abdominal pain localized to the RLQ, nausea, vomiting, and evidence of inflammatory changes in the right lower quadrant observed in the CT scan, consistent with appendicitis. The CT findings reported a dilated hyperemic appendix, inflammatory changes, and a small rim-enhancing collection, indicating a complication of appendicitis.
